result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C. Henderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--To pay restitution of $2966.67, payable to the crime victim compensation program

--To pay restitution of $2980, payable to Blaine Stewart for burial costs

The Court authorizes the prison system to take wages or funds from Mr. Henderson's prison account.

Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 10%  restitution surcharge
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA Surcharge

Court sentences Mr. Henderson to life in prison without parole. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for release to parole, extended supervision or any other type of supervision. It is possible the law may change in the future. The record is to reflect that It is the Court's intent, that Mr. Henderson is to remain in prison for the rest of his life. 

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Continued Hearing on the Defendant's 10/30/17 Motion for Postconviction Relief:  
[MK] case called at 8:49am.
Defendant Michael C. Henderson in court, in custody, with Attorney Ana L. Babcock.   ADA Brookellen Teuber and ADA Theresa Beck appear for the State of Wisconsin. 
The State's Court Officer, Captain R. Johnson, is present.
Attorney Michael Witt is present in the courtroom gallery as counsel for witness DeWhite Johnson. 
-------------------- 
Counsel inform the Court that they have agreed, in relation to the Witness Sequestration Order, that the Probation Agent who previously supervised DeWhite Johnson will remain in the courtroom until DeWhite Johnson is brought into the courtroom. This is for purposes of identication, and after the Agent sees Mr. Johnson, she will exit. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 

DeWhite Johnson- sworn & testifies (in custody, testifying with Attorney Witt present in the courtroom)
--direct examination by Attorney Babcock 
--Defendant's Postconviction Exhibit #1- copy of the Affidavit of Mr. Johnson- received
 -Defendant's Postconviction Exhibit #2- Captain Johnson's narrative report- received
--cross examination by ADA Teuber 
--Mr. Johnson cites his Fifth Amendment Right and refuses to testify 
The Court excuses Attorney WItt; he exits the courtroom at 9:35am. 
recess 9:35am, reconvene 9:50am.

The audio recording of the 7/14/17 interview between Captain Johnson and DeWhite Johnson (Defendant's Postconviction Exhibit #3- received) is played in its entirety. 

Agent Melissa Clausen - sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber 
--State's Postconviction Exhibit #4: data print-out from DeWhite Johnson's ankle brace for 5/28/14- offered and received  
--cross examination by Attorney Babcock
--examination by the Court 
--follow up examination by Attorney Babcock
--follow up examination by ADA Teuber
--further follow up examination by Attorney Babcock 

Captain Randall Johnson- sworn & testifies 
--direct examination by ADA Teuber 
--State's Postconviction Exhibit #5- evidence envelope containing the original letter and Affidavit given by DeWhite Johnson to Captain Johnson- offered and received
--the Court directs the clerk to maintain the Postconviction Exhibit #5 in its original form.  [The exhibit evidence-envelope is resealed by Captain Johnson in the courtroom.] 
--State's Postconviction Exhibit #6- excerpt of Captain Johnson's narrative report- offered and received
--cross examination by Attorney Babcock
--examination by the Court 
---------------

Arguments are given by Attorney Babcock and ADA Teuber.
The Court finds that the submitted Affidavit of DeWhite Johnson is so unreliable that it does not rise to the level of evidence. 
The Court denies the Motion for Postconviction Relief. 
recess 12:06pm.

On the Defendant's 10/30/17 Motion for Postconviction Relief:  
[MK] case called at 8:29am.
Defendant Michael C. Henderson in court, in custody, with Attorney Ana L. Babcock.   ADA Theresa Beck and ADA Brookellen Teuber appear for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of Attorney Babcock, the Court orders witness sequestration.  The State's officer-witness, Detective R. Johnson, is excepted from the Order. 

DeWhite Johnson- sworn & testifies (in custody)
--the Court informs Mr. Henderson of his Fifth Amendment Rights
--examination by the Court regarding Mr. Johnson's understanding of his right not to incriminate himself and his right to remain silent 
--the Court informs Mr. Johnson of his right to be represented by counsel; questions are asked related to Mr. Johnson's competency to represent himself

The Court finds that Mr. Johnson is not competent to waive his right to an attorney.  The Court will not allow him to be questioned by counsel at this juncture. 
The Court indicates that it will proceed with the other evidence today.  However counsel agree that Mr. Johnson's testimony is needed before presentation of the other witnesses and evidence. 
On request of Attorney Babcock, the Court adjourns the hearing.
Counsel provide information on the past interviews of Mr. Johnson.  ADA Teuber submits two discs with recorded interviews, one from July 14, 2017 and the other labeled November  2017 interview, for the Court's review.  
recess 9:06am. 

NEXT:  (1) the Court will appoint counsel for witness DeWhite Johnson,  (2)  Motion Hearing on April 4th at 8:30am. (allow full day)

The Clerk of Courts verified (Per Clerk of Courts telephone conversation with Captain Johnson with the Watertown PD) that the Original Affidavit of DeWhite Johnson was turned over to them by our office per Judge Koschnick's 6/2/17 Order.
It is Ordered that the time for the circuit court to decide the postconviction motion is hereby extended to 2/7/18.

[MK] case called at 3:55pm. 
Defendant Michael C. Henderson in court, in custody, with Attorney Raj Kumar Singh.  ADA Brookellen Teuber and ADA Theresa Beck appear for the State of Wisconsin, along with Sgt. Johnson from the Watertown Police Department. 
The Court scheduled this hearing after Mr. Henderson filed a pro-se Motion for Substitution of Counsel. 
Mr. Henderson confirms that he continues to ask that the Court grant his request for Substitution of Counsel, and to have the Public Defender appoint new counsel. 
The Court summarizes the letter received from trial co-counsel Attorney Laurent; the Court removes Attorney Laurent allows Attorney Laurent to withdraw as co-counsel for the reasons set forth in Attorney Laurent's letter received on 11/3/15. 
Arguments given by ADA Teuber in opposition to Mr. Henderson's Motion. 
Statement made by Attorney Singh.
Mr. Henderson makes a statement. 
The Court denies Mr. Henderson's Motion to Substitute Counsel. The Court clarifies that it is not acting on any other matters raised in Mr. Henderson's letter. 
The Court clarifies that Attorney Singh remains as counsel for Mr. Henderson, and that Mr. Henderson is to remain in custody at the Jefferson County Jail.
